t: By the dawn
And [by] ten nights
And [by] the even [number] and the odd
And [by] the night when it passes,

a: هَلْ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِذِي حِجْرٍ
t: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?

a: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
t: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with 'Aad -
[With] Iram -  who had lofty pillars,

a: الَّتِي لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِي الْبِلَادِ
t: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
And [with] Thamud, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes? -
[All of] whom oppressed within the lands
And increased therein the corruption.
So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
Indeed, your Lord is in observation.

a: فَأَمَّا الْإِنْسَانُ إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكْرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَكْرَمَنِ
t: And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."

a: وَأَمَّا إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَهَانَنِ
t: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
No! But you do not honor the orphan
And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,
And you love wealth with immense love.

a: كَلَّا إِذَا دُكَّتِ الْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
t: No! When the earth has been leveled -  pounded and crushed -
And your Lord has come and the angels, rank upon rank,

a: وَجِيءَ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنْسَانُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ
t: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell -  that Day, man will remember, but what good to him will be the remembrance?
He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."
So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
[To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
And enter among My [righteous] servants
And enter My Paradise."
